trans-unit.source: Converts to UInt32. Truncates anything on the right side of the decimal point, converting negative to positive. In case of overflow a wrapping is performed.
Converts to UInt32. Truncates anything on the right side of the decimal point, converting negative to positive. Raises OverflowError in case of overflow.
Converts to UInt64. Truncates anything on the right side of the decimal point, converting negative to positive. In case of overflow a wrapping is performed.
Converts to UInt64. Truncates anything on the right side of the decimal point, converting negative to positive. Raises OverflowError in case of overflow.
Converts to UInt8. Truncates anything on the right side of the decimal point, converting negative to positive. In case of overflow a wrapping is performed.
Converts to UInt8. Truncates anything on the right side of the decimal point, converting negative to positive. Raises OverflowError in case of overflow.
Converts to a (possibly fractional) number of days.
Converts to a (possibly fractional) number of hours.
Converts to a (possibly fractional) number of minutes.
Converts to a (possibly fractional) number of seconds.
Converts to a (possibly fractional) number of weeks.
Converts to a number of milliseconds.
Converts to a number of nanoseconds.
Copies count elements from self into source. source and self may overlap; the copy is always done in a non-destructive manner.
Copies count elements from self into target. If self and target overlap, behaviour is undefined. Use #move_to if they overlap (slower but always works).
Copies count elements from source into self. source and self may overlap; the copy is always done in a non-destructive manner.
Copies count elements from source into self. If source and self overlap, behaviour is undefined. Use #move_from if they overlap (slower but always works).
Copies a file or directory src_path to dest_path.
Copies a file or directory src_path to dest_path. If src_path is a directory, this method copies all its contents recursively.
Copies a list of files src to dest.
Copies a list of files src to dest. dest must be an existing directory.
Copies the contents of source into this slice.
Copies the contents of this slice into target.
Copies the file src_path to the file or directory dest.
Copies the file src_path to the file or directory dest. If dest is a directory, a file with the same basename as src_path is created in dest Permission bits are copied too.
Copy at most limit bytes from src to dst.
Counts 1-bits in the binary representation of this integer.
Counts the occurrences of other char in this string.
Create a new status instance with the given status code, or raise an error if the status code given is not inside 100..999.
Create a repository with the same name and description as specified in your shard.yml.
Create a simple ECR file named greeter.ecr:
Create one if needed and possible.
Create your feature branch (git checkout -b my-new-feature)
Creates UUID from 16-bytes slice. Raises if slice isn't 16 bytes long. See #initialize for variant and version.
Creates a TCPServer listening on 127.0.0.1:port and adds it as a socket, returning the local address and port the server listens on.
Creates a TCPServer listening on 127.0.0.1:port, adds it as a socket and starts the server.
Creates a TCPServer listening on 127.0.0.1:port, adds it as a socket and starts the server. Blocks until the server is closed.
Creates a TCPServer listening on host:port and adds it as a socket, returning the local address and port the server listens on.
Creates a TCPServer listening on host:port, adds it as a socket and starts the server.
Creates a TCPServer listening on host:port, adds it as a socket and starts the server. Blocks until the server is closed.
Creates a TCPServer listening on address and adds it as a socket, returning the local address and port the server listens on.
Creates a TCPServer listening on an unused port and adds it as a socket.
Creates a UNIXServer bound to address and adds it as a socket.
Creates a UNIXServer bound to path and adds it as a socket.
Creates a Any that wraps the given Type.
Creates a JSON::Any that wraps the given value.
Creates a BigInt from the given num.
Creates a BigInt with the value denoted by str in the given base.
Creates a BigInt with the value zero.
Creates a BigRational from the given num.
Creates a Box with the given object.
Creates a JSON::Builder that will write to the given IO.
Creates a YAML::Builder that will write to the given IO, invokes the block and closes the builder.
Creates a YAML::Builder that will write to the given IO.
Creates a Hash out of Tuple pairs (key, value) returned from the block.
Creates a Hash out of an Enumerable where each element is a 2 element structure (for instance a Tuple or an Array).
Creates a Location instance named name with fixed offset in seconds from UTC.
Creates a Location instance with fixed offset in seconds from UTC.
Creates a Slice of self with the given values, which will be casted to this type with the new method (defined in each Number type).
Creates a StaticArray of self with the given values, which will be casted to this type with the new method (defined in each Number type).
Creates a String from a pointer.
Creates a String from a pointer. Bytes will be copied from the pointer.
Creates a String from the given slice.
Creates a String from the given slice. Bytes will be copied from the slice.
Creates a Box for a reference type (or nil) and returns the same pointer (or NULL)
Creates a Box for an object and returns it as a Void*.
Creates a CSV lexer from a String.
Creates a CSV lexer from an IO.
Creates a Socket from an existing socket file descriptor.
Creates a TCP socket. Consider using TCPSocket or TCPServer unless you need full control over the socket.
Creates a TCPServer from an already configured raw file descriptor
Creates a TCPSocket from an already configured raw file descriptor
Creates a UNIXServer from an already configured raw file descriptor
Creates a UNIXSocket from an already configured raw file descriptor
Creates a builder that will write to the given IO.
Creates a builder that writes to the given io.
Creates a exact representation of float as rational.
Creates a group of objects. Inside a group all breakable objects are either turned into newlines or are output as is, depending on the available width.
Creates a handler that will serve files in the given public_dir, after expanding it (using File#expand_path).
Creates a hard link dest_path which points to src_path.
Creates a hard link dest_path which points to src_path. If dest_path already exists and is a directory, creates a link dest_path/src_path.
Creates a hard link to each path in src_paths inside the dest_dir directory.
Creates a hard link to each path in src_paths inside the dest_dir directory. If dest_dir is not a directory, raises an ArgumentError.
Creates a named UNIX socket, listening on a filesystem pathname.
Creates a named tuple from the given hash, with elements casted to the given types.
Creates a named tuple from the given hash, with elements casted to the given types. Here the Int32 | String union is cast to Int32.
Creates a named tuple that will contain the given arguments.
Creates a new Array of the given size and invokes the given block once for each index of self, assigning the block's value in that index.
Creates a new Array of the given size filled with the same value in each position.
Creates a new Array, allocating an internal buffer with the given capacity, and yielding that buffer.
Creates a new Array, allocating an internal buffer with the given capacity, and yielding that buffer. The given block must return the desired size of the array.
Creates a new BigDecimal from BigIntvalue and UInt64scale, which matches the internal representation.
Creates a new BigDecimal from Float.
Creates a new BigDecimal from Int.
Creates a new BigDecimal from a String.
Creates a new BigRational with num as the numerator and 1 for denominator.
Creates a new BitArray of size bits.
Creates a new FormData::Builder which writes to io, using the multipart boundary boundary.
Creates a new Multipart::Builder which writes the generated multipart message to io, using the multipart boundary boundary.
Creates a new IO::Delimited which wraps io, and can read until the byte sequence read_delimiter (interpreted as UTF-8) is found.

Creates a new IO::Delimited which wraps io, and can read until the byte sequence read_delimiter (interpreted as UTF-8) is found. If sync_close is set, calling #close calls #close on the underlying IO.
Creates a new IO::Delimited which wraps io, and can read until the byte sequence read_delimiter is found.
Creates a new IO::Delimited which wraps io, and can read until the byte sequence read_delimiter is found. If sync_close is set, calling #close calls #close on the underlying IO.
Creates a new Deque of the given size and invokes the block once for each index of the deque, assigning the block's value in that index.
Creates a new Deque of the given size filled with the same value in each position.
Creates a new Deque that copies its items from an Array.
Creates a new Errno with the given message.
Creates a new Errno with the given message. The message will have concatenated the errno message denoted by errno.
Creates a new Time::Format with the given pattern.
Creates a new Time::Format with the given pattern. The given time location will be used when parsing a Time and no time zone is found in it.
Creates a new IO::MultiWriter which writes to writers.
Creates a new IO::MultiWriter which writes to writers. If sync_close is set, calling #close calls #close on all underlying writers.
Creates a new Multipart::Parser which parses io with multipart boundary boundary.
Creates a new Path of POSIX kind.
Creates a new Path of Windows kind.
Creates a new Path of native kind.
Creates a new Prerelease instance with supplied array of identifiers
Creates a new Regex out of the given source String.
Creates a new SemanticVersion instance with the given major, minor, and patch versions and optionally build and pre-release version
Creates a new IO::Sized which wraps io, and can read a maximum of read_size bytes.
Creates a new IO::Sized which wraps io, and can read a maximum of read_size bytes. If sync_close is set, calling #close calls #close on the underlying IO.
Creates a new Slice with the given args.
Creates a new Slice with the given args. The type of the slice will be the union of the type of the given args.
Creates a new IO::Stapled which reads from reader and writes to writer.
Creates a new StaticArray with the given args.
Creates a new StaticArray with the given args. The type of the static array will be the union of the type of the given args, and its size will be the number of elements in args.
Creates a new String by allocating a buffer (Pointer(UInt8)) with the given capacity, then yielding that buffer.

Creates a new String by allocating a buffer (Pointer(UInt8)) with the given capacity, then yielding that buffer. The block must return a tuple with the bytesize and size (UTF-8 codepoints count) of the String. If the returned size is zero, the UTF-8 codepoints count will be lazily computed.
Creates a new String from a pointer, indicating its bytesize count and, optionally, the UTF-8 codepoints count (size).
Creates a new String from a pointer, indicating its bytesize count and, optionally, the UTF-8 codepoints count (size). Bytes will be copied from the pointer.
Creates a new String from the given bytes, which are encoded in the given encoding.
Creates a new TCPServer, waiting to be bound.
Creates a new TCPSocket, waiting to be connected.
Creates a new Time instance representing the current time from the system clock in UTC.
Creates a new Time instance representing the current time from the system clock observed in location (defaults to local time zone).
Creates a new Time instance representing the given date-time in UTC.
Creates a new Time instance representing the given local date-time in location (defaults to local time zone).
Creates a new Time instance that corresponds to the number of milliseconds elapsed since the Unix epoch (1970-01-01 00:00:00 UTC).
Creates a new Time instance that corresponds to the number of seconds and nanoseconds elapsed from epoch (0001-01-01 00:00:00.0 UTC) in UTC.
Creates a new Time instance that corresponds to the number of seconds and nanoseconds elapsed from epoch (0001-01-01 00:00:00.0 UTC) observed in location.
Creates a new Time instance that corresponds to the number of seconds elapsed since the Unix epoch (1970-01-01 00:00:00 UTC).
Creates a new Time instance with the same local date-time representation (wall clock) in a different location.
Creates a new Zone named name with offset from UTC in seconds.
Creates a new Zone named name with offset from UTC in seconds. The parameter dst is used to declare this zone as daylight savings time.
Creates a new HTTP client from a URI, yields it to the block and closes the client afterwards.

Creates a new HTTP client from a URI, yields it to the block and closes the client afterwards. Parses the host, port, and tls configuration from the URI provided. Port defaults to 80 if not specified unless using the https protocol, which defaults to port 443 and sets tls to true.
Creates a new HTTP client from a URI.

Creates a new HTTP client from a URI. Parses the host, port, and tls configuration from the URI provided. Port defaults to 80 if not specified unless using the https protocol, which defaults to port 443 and sets tls to true.
Creates a new HTTP client, yields it to the block, and closes the client afterwards.
Creates a new HTTP server with a handler chain constructed from the handlers array and the given block.
Creates a new HTTP server with the handlers array as handler chain.
Creates a new HTTP server with the given handler.
Creates a new HTTP server with the given block as handler.
Creates a new SSL server wrapping wrapped and yields it to the block.
Creates a new SSL server wrapping wrapped.
Creates a new TCP connection to a remote TCP server.
Creates a new TCP server and yields it to the block.
Creates a new TCP server and yields it to the block. Eventually closes the server socket when the block returns.
Creates a new TCP server, listening on all interfaces, and yields it to the block.
Creates a new TCP server, listening on all interfaces, and yields it to the block. Eventually closes the server socket when the block returns.
Creates a new TCP server, listening on all local interfaces (::).
Creates a new UNIX server and yields it to the block.
Creates a new UNIX server and yields it to the block. Eventually closes the server socket when the block returns.
Creates a new directory at the given path, including any non-existing intermediate directories.
Creates a new directory at the given path, including any non-existing intermediate directories. The linux-style permission mode can be specified, with a default of 777 (0o777).
Creates a new directory at the given path.
Creates a new directory at the given path. The linux-style permission mode can be specified, with a default of 777 (0o777).
Creates a new directory at the given paths, including any non-existing intermediate directories.
Creates a new directory at the given paths, including any non-existing intermediate directories. The linux-style permission mode can be specified, with a default of 777 (0o777).
Creates a new directory at the given paths.
Creates a new directory at the given paths. The linux-style permission mode can be specified, with a default of 777 (0o777).
Creates a new directory at the given path, including any non-existing intermediate directories.
Creates a new directory at the given path, including any non-existing intermediate directories. The linux-style permission mode can be specified, with a default of 777 (0o777).
Creates a new directory at the given path.
Creates a new directory at the given path. The linux-style permission mode can be specified, with a default of 777 (0o777).
Creates a new empty Array backed by a buffer that is initially initial_capacity big.
Creates a new empty Deque backed by a buffer that is initially initial_capacity big.
Creates a new empty Hash where the default_value is returned if a key is missing.
Creates a new empty Hash with a block for handling missing keys.
Creates a new empty Hash with a block that handles missing keys.
Creates a new empty string pool.
Creates a new instance by parsing the Cookie and Set-Cookie headers in the given HTTP::Headers.
Creates a new instance from the given String or IO, and yields it to the given block once for each row in the CSV.
Creates a new instance from the given String or IO.
Creates a new link (also known as a hard link) at new_path to an existing file given by old_path.
Creates a new logger that will log to the given io.
Creates a new logger that will log to the given io. If io is nil then all log calls will be silently ignored.
Creates a new parser which parses io with multipart boundary boundary.
Creates a new parser, with its configuration specified in the block, and uses it to parse the passed args (defaults to ARGV).
Creates a new parser, with its configuration specified in the block.
Creates a new pretty printer that will write to the given output and be capped at maxwidth.
Creates a new reader from a string.
Creates a new reader from an IO.
Creates a new reader from the given filename, yields it to the given block, and closes it at the end.
Creates a new reader from the given filename.
Creates a new reader from the given io, yields it to the given block, and closes it at its end.
Creates a new reader from the given io, yields it to the given block, and closes it at the end.
Creates a new reader from the given io.
Creates a new set from the elements in enumerable.
Creates a new static array and invokes the block once for each index of the array, assigning the block's value in that index.
Creates a new static array filled with the given value.
Creates a new writer for the given io, yields it to the given block, and closes it at its end.
Creates a new writer to the given filename, yields it to the given block, and closes it at the end.
Creates a new writer to the given filename.
Creates a new writer to the given io, yields it to the given block, and closes it at the end.
Creates a new writer to the given io.
Creates a pair of bidirectional pipe endpoints connected with each other and passes them to the given block.
Creates a pair of bidirectional pipe endpoints connected with each other and returns them in a Tuple.
Creates a pair of pipe endpoints (connected to each other) and passes them to the given block.
Creates a pair of pipe endpoints (connected to each other) and passes them to the given block. Both endpoints are closed after the block.
Creates a pair of pipe endpoints (connected to each other) and returns them as a two-element Tuple.
Creates a pair of unamed UNIX sockets (see .pair) and yields them to the block.
Creates a pair of unamed UNIX sockets (see .pair) and yields them to the block. Eventually closes both sockets when the block returns.
Creates a parser from a String or IO.
Creates a parser from a String or IO. Optionally takes the optional separator and quote_char arguments for specifying non-standard cell separators and quote characters
Creates a parser, yields it to the block, and closes the parser at the end of it.
Creates a pretty printer and yields it to the block, appending any output to the given io.
Creates a process, executes it, but doesn't wait for it to complete.
Creates a reader that will be positioned at the last char of the given string.
Creates a reader with the specified string positioned at byte index pos.
Creates a scalar with the given value.
Creates a slice to the given pointer, bounded by the given size.
Creates a slice to the given pointer, bounded by the given size. This method does not allocate heap memory.
Creates a string representation of self.
Creates a symbolic link dest_path which points to src_path.
Creates a symbolic link dest_path which points to src_path. If dest_path already exists and is a directory, creates a link dest_path/src_path.
Creates a symbolic link at new_path to an existing file given by old_path.
Creates a symbolic link to each path in src_paths inside the dest_dir directory, ignoring any overwritten paths.
Creates a symbolic link to each path in src_paths inside the dest_dir directory.
Creates a symbolic link to each path in src_paths inside the dest_dir directory. If dest_dir is not a directory, raises an ArgumentError.
Creates a temporary file and yields it to the given block.
Creates a temporary file and yields it to the given block. It is closed and returned at the end of this method call.
Creates a tuple from the given array, with elements casted to the given types.
Creates a tuple that will contain the given values.
Creates an OpenSSL::SSL::Server and adds it as a socket.
Creates an UNIXSocket from the internal OS representation.
Creates an Array of self with the given values, which will be casted to this type with the new method (defined in each Number type).
Creates an IPAddress from the internal OS representation.
Creates an IPAddress from the internal OS representation. Supports both INET and INET6 families.
Creates an IO::Memory that will read, and optionally write, from/to the given slice.
Creates an IO::Memory that will read, and optionally write, from/to the given slice. The created IO::Memory is non-resizeable.
Creates an IO::Memory whose contents are the exact contents of string.
Creates an IO::Memory whose contents are the exact contents of string. The created IO::Memory is non-resizeable and non-writeable.
Creates an Expectation that passes if actual and value are identical (.same?).
Creates an Expectation that passes if actual ends with expected (.ends_with?).
Creates an Expectation that passes if actual ends with expected (.ends_with?). Works on String.
Creates an Expectation that passes if actual equals value (==).
Creates an Expectation that passes if actual includes expected (.includes?).
Creates an Expectation that passes if actual includes expected (.includes?). Works on collections and String.
Creates an Expectation that passes if actual is empty (.empty?).
Creates an Expectation that passes if actual is false (== false).
Creates an Expectation that passes if actual is falsy (nil or false).
Creates an Expectation that passes if actual is nil (== nil).
Creates an Expectation that passes if actual is of type type (is_a?).
Creates an Expectation that passes if actual is true (== true).
Creates an Expectation that passes if actual is truthy (neither nil nor false).
Creates an Expectation that passes if actual is within delta of expected.
Creates an Expectation that passes if actual matches value (=~).
Creates an Expectation that passes if actual starts with expected (.starts_with?).
Creates an Expectation that passes if actual starts with expected (.starts_with?). Works on String.
Creates an Atomic with the given initial value.
Creates an UDP socket. Consider using UDPSocket unless you need full control over the socket.
Creates an UNIX socket. Consider using UNIXSocket or UNIXServer unless you need full control over the socket.
Creates an alias with tha given anchor.
Creates an empty, resizeable and writeable IO::Memory with the given initialize capactiy for the internal buffer.
Creates an instance of Flate::Reader for the gzip format, yields it to the given block, and closes it at its end.
Creates an instance of Flate::Reader for the gzip format.
Creates an instance of Flate::Reader for the gzip format. has written.
Creates an instance of Flate::Writer. #close must be invoked after all data has written.
Creates an instance specified by a commercial week date consisting of ISO calendar year, week and a day_of_week.
Creates another UUID which is a copy of uuid, but allows overriding variant or version.
Creates new UUID by decoding value string from hyphenated (ie.

Creates new UUID by decoding value string from hyphenated (ie. ba714f86-cac6-42c7-8956-bcf5105e1b81), hexstring (ie. 89370a4ab66440c8add39e06f2bb6af6) or URN (ie. urn:uuid:3f9eaf9e-cdb0-45cc-8ecb-0e5b2bfb0c20) format.
Cross-compiling can be done for other executables, but its main target is the compiler. If Crystal isn't available in some system you can try cross-compiling it there.
Crystal allows you to bind to existing C libraries without writing a single line in C.
Crystal can generate documentation from comments using a subset of Markdown.
Crystal comes with a fully-featured spec library in the Spec module. It provides a structure for writing executable examples of how your code should behave.
Crystal does its best to provide sane configuration defaults (see Mozilla-Intermediate).
Crystal has a built-in documentation generator. Use it!
Crystal has a built-in testing library. Use it!
Crystal has Channels inspired by CSP. They allow communicating data between fibers without sharing memory and without having to worry about locks, semaphores or other special structures.
Crystal is a programming language with the following goals:
Crystal is available as a compiled package. However, it might not be the most recent version available.
Crystal is still under heavy development. There can be breaking changes but we're trying to keep them as minimum as possible.
Crystal is typically accompanied by Shards, its dependency manager.
Crystal modifies this meaning to have essentially one unique "m" flag that activates both behaviours, so here we do the same by mapping MULTILINE to PCRE_MULTILINE | PCRE_DOTALL.
Crystal primitive types, Time and Bytes implement this method. YAML.mapping can be used to implement this method for user types.
Crystal primitive types, Time, Bytes and Union implement this method. YAML.mapping can be used to implement this method for user types.
Crystal provides a few pseudo-constants which provide reflective data about the source code being executed.
Crystal provides basic methods to do type reflection, casting and introspection.
Crystal provides several literals for creating values of some basic types.
Crystal structs marked with the @[Extern] attribute
Crystal supports a basic form of cross compilation.

Crystal supports an additional literal for arrays and array-like types. It consists of the name of the type followed by a list of elements enclosed in curly braces ({}) and individual elements separated by a comma (,).
Crystal supports an additional literal for hashes and hash-like types. It consists of the name of the type followed by a list of comma separated key-value pairs enclosed in curly braces ({}).
Crystal's built-in code formatter can be used not just to format your code, but also to format code samples included in documentation blocks.

Crystal's built-in testing library. It provides a structure for writing executable examples of how your code should behave. A domain specific language allows you to write them in a way similar to natural language.
Crystal's philosophy is to require as few type restrictions as possible. However, some restrictions are required.
Crystal's way to do error handling is by raising and rescuing exceptions.
Currently, it is only available for aarch64 and amd64 platforms.
Currently, the package is only available for aarch64 and x86_64 platforms.
Customizable Proc (with a reasonable default) which the Logger uses to format and print its entries.
DEPRECATED JSON::PullParser#kind now is an enum, please use that instead of symbols
DEPRECATED This module is deprecated as of Crystal 0.28.0. Its behaviour has been fully integrated into Comparable.
DEPRECATED Use JSON::Token#kind, which is an enum
Data can be stored within an annotation.
Decodes the given slice UTF-16 sequence into a String and returns the pointer after reading.
Decodes the given slice UTF-16 sequence into a String and returns the pointer after reading. The string ends when a zero value is found.
Decodes the given slice UTF-16 sequence into a String.
Decomposes given floating point value into a normalized fraction and an integral power of two.
Default SI prefixes ordered by magnitude.
Default initialization can be skipped by calling MIME.init(false) before the first query to the MIME database.
Default maximum permitted combined size (in bytes) of the headers in an HTTP request.
Default maximum permitted size (in bytes) of the request line in an HTTP request.
Default namespaces ("xmlns=" style) for self are included in this array; Default namespaces for ancestors, however, are not.
Defaults to TLS_method or SSLv23_method (depending on OpenSSL version) which tells OpenSSL to negotiate the TLS or SSL protocol with the remote endpoint.
Defines #hash and #== method from the given fields.
Defines a #hash(hasher) that will append a hash value for the given fields.
Defines a clone method that returns a copy of this object with all instance variables cloned (clone is in turn invoked on them).
Defines a to_s(io) method whose body is the ECR contained in filename, translated to Crystal code.
Defines a Struct with the given name and properties.
Defines a byte format to encode integers and floats from/to Bytes and IO.
Defines a yet-to-be-implemented pending test case
Defines an #== method by comparing the given fields.
Defines an example group that describes a unit to be tested.
Defines an example group that describes a unit to be tested. Inside &block examples are defined by #it or #pending.
Defines an example group that establishes a specific context, like empty array versus array with elements.
Defines an example group that establishes a specific context, like empty array versus array with elements. Inside &block examples are defined by #it or #pending.
Defines getter methods for each of the given arguments.
Defines property methods for each of the given arguments.
Defines query getter methods for each of the given arguments.
Defines query property methods for each of the given arguments.
Defines raise-on-nil and nilable getter methods for each of the given arguments.
Defines raise-on-nil property methods for each of the given arguments.
Defines setter methods for each of the given arguments.
Defines the main routine run by normal Crystal programs:
Deletes a file or directory path. If path is a directory, this method removes all its contents recursively.
Deletes a file or directory path. If path is a directory, this method removes all its contents recursively. Ignores all errors.
Deletes a list of files or directories paths.
Deletes a list of files or directories paths. If one path is a directory, this method removes all its contents recursively.
Deletes a list of files or directories paths. If one path is a directory, this method removes all its contents recursively. Ignores all errors.
Deletes all values for provided param name.
Deletes all values for provided param name. Returns array of deleted values.
Deletes and returns the HTTP::Cookie for the specified key, or returns nil if key cannot be found in the collection.
Deletes and returns the HTTP::Cookie for the specified key, or returns nil if key cannot be found in the collection. Note that key should match the the name attribute of the desired HTTP::Cookie.
Deletes and returns the first key-value pair in the hash, or raises IndexError if the hash is empty.
Deletes and returns the first key-value pair in the hash.
Deletes and returns the first key-value pair in the hash. Yields to the given block if the hash is empty.
Deletes attribute given by name. Returns attributes value, or nil if attribute not found.
Deletes each key-value pair for which the given block returns true.
Deletes first value for provided param name.
Deletes first value for provided param name. If there are no values left, deletes param itself. Returns deleted value.
Deletes the file at path. Deleting non-existent file will raise an exception.
Deletes the item that is present at the index.
Deletes the item that is present at the index. Items to the right of this one will have their indices decremented. Raises IndexError if trying to delete an element outside the deque's range.
Deletes the key-value pair and returns the value, else yields key with given block.
Deletes the key-value pair and returns the value, otherwise returns nil.
Depending on the OpenSSL version, the available defaults are default, pkcs7, smime_sign, ssl_client and ssl_server.
Deque has a subset of Array's API. It performs better than an Array when there are frequent insertions or deletions of items near the beginning or the end.

Deserialization also respects default values of variables:
Deserializes a YAML document according to the core schema.
Deserializes multiple YAML documents according to the core schema.
Deserializes the given JSON in string_or_io into an instance of self, assuming the JSON consists of an JSON object with key root, and whose value is the value to deserialize.
Deserializes the given JSON in string_or_io into an instance of self.

Deserializes the given JSON in string_or_io into an instance of self. This simply creates a parser = JSON::PullParser and invokes new(parser): classes that want to provide JSON deserialization must provide an def initialize(parser : JSON::PullParser) method.
Destructively transforms all values using a block.
Destructively transforms all values using a block. Same as transform_values but modifies in place. The block cannot change a type of values.
Details on the exact cause can be found in the error message.
Determines Regex's source validity. If it is, nil is returned. If it's not, a String containing the error message is returned.
Determines if self equals other according to a comparison done by the given block.
Determines if self overrides any method named method from type type.
Determines if a string needs to be quoted to be used for a symbol.
Determines if this IO does write buffering.
Determines if this IO does write buffering. If true, no buffering is done.
Determines if this IO is closed.
Determines whether this IO buffers reads.
Difference. Returns a new Array that is a copy of self, removing any items that appear in other. The order of self is preserved.
Difference: returns a new set containing elements in this set that are not present in the other enumerable.
Difference: returns a new set containing elements in this set that are not present in the other.
Disables the Nagle algorithm when set to true, otherwise enables it.
Divides self with another BigDecimal, with a optionally configurable max_div_iterations, which defines a maximum number of iterations in case the division is not exact.

Do you consider yourself a helpful person? If you find bugs or sections which need more clarification you're welcome to contribute to this language reference. You can submit a pull request to this repository: https://github.com/crystal-lang/crystal-book
Document your code with comments. All of it. Even the private methods.
Documentation should be positioned right above definitions of classes, modules, and methods. Leave no blanks between them.
Documenting that the method's return value is of no interest
Doesn't write anything to the given IO.

Don't change the method unless you must restrict a specific protocol to be used (eg: TLSv1.2) and nothing else. You should specify options to disable specific protocols, yet allow to negotiate from various other ones. For example the following snippet will enable the TLSv1, TLSv1.1 and TLSv1.2 protocols but disable the deprecated SSLv2 and SSLv3 protocols:
Don't create intermediate strings when writing to an IO
Download the file for your platform and uncompress it. Inside it you will have a bin/crystal executable.
Drops membership to the specified group.
Drops membership to the specified group. Memberships are automatically dropped when the socket is closed or the process exits. Raises Socket::Error if an incompatible address is provided.

Due to the concurrent nature of this macro, it is highly recommended to handle any exceptions within the concurrent calls. Unhandled exceptions raised within the concurrent operations will be re-raised inside the parent fiber as ConcurrentExecutionException, with the cause attribute set to the original exception.
Duplicates the current process. Returns a Process representing the new child process in the current process and nil inside the new child process.
During the block duration self becomes read-only, so multiple concurrent open are allowed.
During this guide crystal-lang/crystal-mysql will be used.
Dynamically assigning values to constants using the chained assignment or the multiple assignment is not supported and results in a syntax error.
Each Time instance allows querying calendar data:
Each block variable has the type of every yield expression in that position. For example:
Each connection is processed concurrently in a separate Fiber and can handle multiple subsequent requests-response cycles with connection keep-alive.
Each constant (member) in the enum has the type of the enum:
Each constant in the enum has the type of the enum:
Each member is identified by its ordinal number starting from Monday = 1 according to ISO 8601.
Each method has two variants, one returns a string, the other writes directly to an IO.
Each object in each tuple is compared using the #<=> operator.
Each of the above kinds of variables will be explained later on.
Each of these methods returns the Socket::Address that was added to this server.
Each one of them is optional, so a method can do without the double splat, without the splat, without keyword arguments and without positional arguments.
Each parameter defines a set, the character is matched against the intersection of those, in other words it needs to match all sets.

Each time is attached to a specific time zone, represented by a Location (see #location). #zone returns the time zone observed in this location at the current time (i.e. the instant represented by this Time). #offset returns the offset of the current zone in seconds.
Eliminate .. elements that begin a rooted path:
Eliminate each .. path name element (the parent directory) preceded
Eliminate each . path name element (the current directory).

Embedded Crystal (ECR) is a template language for embedding Crystal code into other text, that includes but is not limited to HTML. The template is read and transformed at compile time and then embedded into the binary.
Embeds an ECR file filename into the program and appends the content to an IO in the variable io_name.
Embeds an ECR file filename into the program and renders it to a string.
Emits a string formated according to RFC 3339 (ISO 8601 profile).
Emits an alias to the given anchor.
Emits an attribute with namespace info and a value.
Emits an element with namespace info with the given attributes.
Emits an element with the given attributes.
Emits the end of a CDATA section.
Emits the end of a comment.
Emits the end of a document.
Emits the end of an attribute.
Emits the end of an element.
Emits the given attributes with their values.
Emits the scalar "< followed by an alias to the given anchor.
Emits the start of a CDATA section, invokes the block and then emits the end of the CDATA section.
Emits the start of a CDATA section.
Emits the start of a DTD, invokes the block and then emits the end of the DTD.
Emits the start of a comment, invokes the block and then emits the end of the comment.
Emits the start of a comment.
Emits the start of an attribute with namespace info.
Emits the start of an attribute, invokes the block, and then emits the end of the attribute.
Emits the start of an attribute.
Emits the start of an element with namespace info with the given attributes, invokes the block and then emits the end of the element.
Emits the start of an element with namespace info.
Emits the start of an element with the given attributes, invokes the block and then emits the end of the element.
Emits the start of an element.
Emits the start of the document, invokes the block, and then emits the end of the document.
Emits the start of the document.
Empties a Hash and returns it.

Enables character processing for the duration of the given block.

Enables character processing for the duration of the given block. The so called cooked mode is the standard behavior of a terminal, doing line wise editing by the terminal and only sending the input to the program on a newline. Only call this when this IO is a TTY, such as a not redirected stdin.
Enables character processing for this IO.

Enables character processing for this IO. The so called cooked mode is the standard behavior of a terminal, doing line wise editing by the terminal and only sending the input to the program on a newline. Only call this when this IO is a TTY, such as a not redirected stdin.
Enables raw mode for the duration of the given block.

Enables raw mode for the duration of the given block. In raw mode every keypress is directly sent to the program, no interpretation is done by the terminal. Only call this when this IO is a TTY, such as a not redirected stdin.
Enables raw mode for this IO.

Enables raw mode for this IO. In raw mode every keypress is directly sent to the program, no interpretation is done by the terminal. Only call this when this IO is a TTY, such as a not redirected stdin.
Encodes a string to an RFC 2616 quoted-string.
Encodes a string to an RFC 2616 quoted-string. Encoded string is written to io. May raise when string contains an invalid character.
Encodes a string to an RFC 2616 quoted-string. May raise when string contains an invalid character.
Enum is the base type of all enums.
